definition: common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The Results reflected both commonality and uniqueness of the three types of groups.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果显示三种类型团体的共通性与独特性。

sentences.english: The superficial differences in their tragic myths cannot hide their similarities in spirit.
sentences.chinese: 其悲剧神话之表相差异，难掩两者内在精神之共通性。

sentences.english: Moreover, proved the resemblance between the phenomenology and ancient philosophy in China.
sentences.chinese: 并通过对比得出现象学与中国古代哲学的共通性。

sentences.english: So the comparative literature research should turn from commonness to difference.
sentences.chinese: 因此，比较文学研究应从共通性转向差异性。
